result.execSummary:
Jeremy G. Hebson was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Jeremy G. Hebson was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy G. Hebson

records.addlTxt: Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody pro se.  Deft wishes to proceed w/o counsel.  Deft wishes to waive extradition to Iowa.  Deft signs the waiver of extradition papers; Court approves the extradition.
Extradition hearing on October 16, 2014 at 09:15 am.
Extradition hrg to be rescheduled due to ongoing jury trial

1:57 pm    Atty Jerrold Hinshaw appeared as Special Prosecutor for the State.  Defendant appeared in custody.  Deft waives his right to counsel.  Clerk:  NJ.  Referred to Br. 3 for further disposition on 10-6-14 @ 10:45 - Waiver hearing.  $50,000 cash bond set.  DE will waive extradition.
and witness list filed by the State
